docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 13 -- Secretary General Dag Hammarskjold cautioned today against any effort to alter the present aims of the United Nations' information activities.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 13 -- Secretary General Dag Hammarskjold cautioned today against any effort to alter the present aims of the United Nations' information activities.
docs.abstract: Assembly com opens debate on proposed 'pub relations' approach on information; Hammarskjold opposes change; Sen Hickenlooper offers resolution leaving adoption of any changes to Hammarskjold discretion; scores proposal to end broadcasts to nations that do not rebroadcast them; Brit resolution backs experts rept and sets $4.5-million ceiling on funds

headline.main: U.N. CHIEF OPPOSES PROPAGANDA ROLE; Warns Against Proposal to Shift Information Policy to a 'Selling Operation'

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCHSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MENDOZA, Argentina, Nov. 8 -- Ten Colgate University students have opened at the University of Cuyo here a temporary southern branch of their college at Hamilton, N. Y.
docs.lead_paragraph: MENDOZA, Argentina, Nov. 8 -- Ten Colgate University students have opened at the University of Cuyo here a temporary southern branch of their college at Hamilton, N. Y.
docs.abstract: 10 from Colgate U (US) study at Cuyo U (Argentina) under Williams Foundation auspices to test bridging differences

headline.main: ARGENTINA HOST TO COLGATE MEN; 10 of University's Students Begin Study at Mendoza in Foothills of Andes

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (UPI) -- Despite the huge volume of red meat produced in the United States, the average United States citizen falls far short of being the world's biggest meat eater.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (UPI) -- Despite the huge volume of red meat produced in the United States, the average United States citizen falls far short of being the world's biggest meat eater.

headline.main: U.S. IN FIFTH PLACE AS USER OF MEAT; Argentina Led World in '57 With 242 Lbs. Per Capita -- Consumption Here Down

docs.snippet: ROME, Nov. 17 -- International significance was seen here today in the new Cardinals named by Pope John XXIII.
docs.lead_paragraph: ROME, Nov. 17 -- International significance was seen here today in the new Cardinals named by Pope John XXIII.

headline.main: SIGNIFICANCE SEEN IN NEW CARDINALS; An Emphasis on Western Hemisphere and Rome Curia Is Indicated

byline.original: By PAUL HOFMANNSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: ROME, Nov. 17 -- Pope John XXIII named twenty-three new Cardinals today. Among them were Archbishop Richard James Cushing of Boston and Archbishop John Francis O'Hara of Philadelphia.
docs.lead_paragraph: ROME, Nov. 17 -- Pope John XXIII named twenty-three new Cardinals today. Among them were Archbishop Richard James Cushing of Boston and Archbishop John Francis O'Hara of Philadelphia.
docs.abstract: Pope names 23 new Cardinals, raising Coll of Cardinals members to 75; Amer Abps Gushing and O'Hara among 23; rise to 75 is break with 372-yr-old tradition, when Pope Sixtus V set 70 as maximum; consistory to invest new Cardinals set for Dec 15; Cushing, O'Hara illus

headline.main: Two Americans Among 23 New Cardinals; Cushing and O'Hara Named -- 13 Italians to Get Red Hats 2 U. S. PRELATES TO BE CARDINALS

byline.original: By ARNALDO CORTESISpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Commodore Thomas Simmons has left the new Moore-McCormack liner Brasil after two voyages, to take command of her sister ship, the Argentina, which is nearing completion.
docs.lead_paragraph: Commodore Thomas Simmons has left the new Moore-McCormack liner Brasil after two voyages, to take command of her sister ship, the Argentina, which is nearing completion.

headline.main: Simmons Picked to Head Liner Argentina As Pierce Takes Command of the Brasil

docs.snippet: A strong market with active dealings in the Canadian dollar marked the trading in foreign exchanges during the past week. British pound sterling after maintaining a steady undertone for some time sold off in the latter part of the business sessions.
docs.lead_paragraph: A strong market with active dealings in the Canadian dollar marked the trading in foreign exchanges during the past week. British pound sterling after maintaining a steady undertone for some time sold off in the latter part of the business sessions.

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; Week Ended Nov. 21, 1958

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 28 -- "A country that has such beautiful social laws deserves a better economic break: Do you know our Constitution?"
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 28 -- "A country that has such beautiful social laws deserves a better economic break: Do you know our Constitution?"
docs.abstract: welfare state seen at stake in election; cost of soc gains under Colorado party led by Batlle Berres aggravates inflation, other econ problems

headline.main: URUGUAY WEIGHS COST OF WELFARE; Election Hinges on Inflation and the Desire of Voters to Keep Social Gains

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 29 -- Nearly a million men and women are expected to vote tomorrow in a general election that will test the Colorado party's post-war domination of Uruguayan politics.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 29 -- Nearly a million men and women are expected to vote tomorrow in a general election that will test the Colorado party's post-war domination of Uruguayan politics.

headline.main: MILLION MAY VOTE IN URUGUAY TODAY; Dominant Colorado Party Faces Challenge From United Opposition
